Column Comment.0: MAPPING IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a mapping between systems.
Column Comment.1: MAPPING DETAIL OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique number identifying eachindividual mapping for the systems.
Column Comment.2: RULE SEQUENCE NUMBER: Identifies the order in which the mapping rules are tobe carried out, in order to ensure maximum quality.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: CREATE METHOD TYPE: The type of method that is used to create the value in thiscolumn. The method could include manual selection and key entry, automatedrandom generation, concatenation of values etc. If you wish, the code used togenerate the key value can be stored in PPDM COLUMN, and the last assigned keycan also be stored.
Column Comment.5: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.6: DEPENDENT COLUMN NAME: Name of the column within a specific table found inthe schema. Use to identify the column on which the rule depends, such as thecolumn used for a comparison or calculation or verification.
Column Comment.7: DEPENDENT SCHEMA ENTITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an entity or objectin an XML or EDI schema. Use to identify the element on which the rule depends,such as the element on which the rule must be carried out (for example, when acomponent must be queried or calculated.
Column Comment.8: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema. Use to identify the system ID on which the rule depends,such as the system in which the rule must be carried out (for example, when acomponent must be queried or calculated.
Column Comment.9: DEPENDENT TABLE NAME: The name of the table within a schema. Use to identifythe table on which the rule depends, such as the reference table from which thecolumn value must be drawn.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data is no longer valid.
Column Comment.12: PPDM RULE TYPE: The type of rule that is used, such as one that uses acomparison of values in this or another column to determine where the mappingshould go, or one that uses the contents of the value to determine the location of themapping.
Column Comment.13: MAXIMUM VALUE: The maxumum value that is a condition for this value to beincluded in this mapping rule.
Column Comment.14: MAX VALUE ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure in which themax value was originally received.
Column Comment.16: MINIMUM VALUE: The minumum value that is a condition for this value to beincluded in this mapping rule.
Column Comment.17: MIN VALUE ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure in which themin value was originally received.
Column Comment.19: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.20: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this mapping is a preferredversion of the mapping.
Column Comment.21: PROCEDURE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a procedure or function.
Column Comment.22: PROCEDURE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the system that containsthe procedure controlling or involking the mapping rule.
Column Comment.23: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.24: RING SEQUENCE NUMBER: where relevant, you may indicate the order in whichthis mapping must be loaded in order to conform to the Load of the Rings policy.
Column Comment.25: RULE DESCRIPTION: description of the mapping logic or creation logic for a column.
Column Comment.26: RULE OWNER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: unique identifier for the business associatewho owns this rule for mapping.
Column Comment.27: RULE VERSION REFERENCE NUMBER: a numer identifying the version of the rulefor mapping between systems that this represents.
Column Comment.28: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.29: SOFTWARE APPLICATION IDENTIFIER: The identifier for the application that ownsthis alias or code or that is used to apply the data in this row.
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
